summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) has helped Palantir redefine its business over the last two years . The company's main growth catalyst is now the private sector . Analyst Dan Ives thinks the company could reach a $1 trillion valuation in two or three years .  Palantir's shares have gained about 1,090% since its initial public offering (IPO) in 2020 . Much of the company's business still revolves around government contracts . Rising interest in AI has fueled a new wave of potential for the company -- particularly in the private sector .  Palantir has relied heavily on deal flow from the DOD and adjacent government agencies for much of its 20-year history . While there are big bucks to be made in defense contracting, public sector business tends to be lumpy . Wall Street loathes businesses whose growth prospects look unreliable .  Palantir's dominance in the software realm over the last couple of years, coupled with a bullish overall sentiment around the AI opportunity, explains the stock's incredible rise . The company is also signing more meaningful deals, underscored by consistently rising revenue and widening profit margins .  Palantir is one of the priciest stocks in the software space today, and history suggests that shares are due for a pullback . The average consensus price target among analysts is about $94, suggesting about 21% downside . Back in the late 1990s, internet stocks were experiencing their own moment of euphoria .  Palantir's valuation multiples will likely compress over the next couple of years . Investors should prepare for some valuation compression in the near term . Valuation multiples generally normalize over the long term .  The most prudent strategy regarding an investment in Palantir is to buy the stock at different price points and take advantage of dips . That doesn't necessarily mean the company won't ever become a trillion-dollar stock . Instead of focusing on the next two or three years, investors should think longer term . Between 2023 and 2024, theS&P 500 generated total returns of 58% and 87% . Amazon, Microsoft, Alphabet, and Meta Platforms all confirmed their plans for massive AI infrastructure spending . Advanced Micro Devices also shared encouraging details regarding the outlook for its next-generation GPUs .  Nvidia could see its shares surge after it reports its first-quarter results on May 28 . Investors ought to pay close attention toMicrosoft,Amazon,Alphabet,Meta Platforms, andAdvanced Micro Devices .  These three "Magnificent Seven" members are on track to spend a combined $260 billion on AI capex this year . AMD, Meta Platforms and AMD are also spending big on AI-powered wearable hardware .  The graph below illustrates Nvidia's stock price over the last three years . Nvidia stock has risen considerably across this period -- but we already knew that . Since Nvidia reported its Q2 2024 earnings in August, the stock has actually dropped by about 9%.  Analysts' consensus estimates are for Nvidia's revenue and earnings to nearly double over the next two years . Su's remarks underscore this idea, as she expects production of AMD's next-generation chip architecture to begin scaling up in the latter portion of the year .  Nvidia remains well positioned to dominate the AI infrastructure market over the coming years . For these reasons, I think Nvidia stock will soar following its earnings report later this month . I see the stock as a no-brainer buying opportunity right now .  John Mackey, former CEO of Whole Foods Market, is a member of The Motley Fool's board of directors . Randi Zuckerberg is a former director of market development and spokeswoman for Facebook .  This article was originally published by The Motley Fool . OpenAI is reportedly in a tough negotiation with one of its biggest investors and partners, Microsoft . The AI startup recently announced a major change to its corporate restructuring plans . Microsoft has invested $13 billion in OpenAI to date . The companies are also reportedly renegotiating their broader contract .  Microsoft and Openai may be renegotiating their partnership . Microsoft's enterprise enterprise business has grown as it pursues its ambitious Stargate infrastructure project .

Microsoft and OpenAI are rewriting terms of their multibillion-dollar partnership . Microsoft is offering to give up some of its equity stake in exchange for access to new technology developed beyond 2030 . Microsoft declined to comment on the report .  Microsoft changed some terms of a deal with OpenAI after entering a joint venture with Oracle and SoftBank Group to build up to $500 billion of new artificial intelligence data centers in the U.S. restructuring, The Information reported last week .

The Trump administration is looking to fast-track the deployment of nuclear reactors in the U.S. Nuclear power is considered by many to be a reliable, clean energy source that can meet growing energy demand while reducing emissions . Numerous countries have signed a pledge to triple nuclear production capacity by 2050 .  Constellation Energy is the largest producer of carbon-free electricity in the United States . Its focus on nuclear energy gives it a reliable source of electricity that isn't affected by weather fluctuations . The rising demand for energy from data centers and tech companies has boosted Constellation's appeal .  Constellation plans to restart the Three Mile Island Unit 1 reactor as part of this deal . As global demand for nuclear energy rises, Cameco is well-positioned to benefit from increasing uranium prices and new nuclear reactor construction .  Cameco has agreements to provide an average of 28 million pounds of uranium annually through 2029 . Cameco also has properties in Saskatchewan and Australia with significant uranium deposits . NuScale Power is an innovator in the space thanks to its cutting-edge small modular reactors .  NuScale has a first-mover advantage in the SMR market . The company's 50 MWe (megawatt electric) SMR is the first approved by the U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission . NuScale is best suited for aggressive investors who are ready to hold onto their shares . AMD's revenue surged 36% year over year last quarter, yet its stock trades at just 22 times this year's earnings estimate . C3.ai could see accelerating demand for its AI software following partnerships with Microsoft .  AMD's data center segment posted a 57% year-over-year increase in revenue . Amazon recently revealed a small stake in the company's stock, which is a vote of confidence in AMD's technology .  Amazon revealed a new stake in AMD stock worth $84 million at the end of Q1 . Amazon's investment could signal confidence in AMD's offering, especially as a lower-cost alternative to AI chip leader Nvidia . AMD's forward price-to-earnings multiple of 22 seems to significantly undervalue AMD's ability to serve a massive AI chip opportunity .  C3.ai reported a 26% year-over-year increase in revenue in the January-ending fiscal third quarter . The consensus Wall Street estimate has the company's revenue increasing by 25% next quarter . Its software is used for classified work in the U.S. military and mission-critical software for large corporations .  C3.ai is winning over industry leaders with its focus on solving complicated problems for large businesses that have sprawling supply chains and global operations . Palantir stock commands a high price-to-sales multiple of 87 at the time of this writing . The technology sector has produced some of the biggest winners in the stock market in recent decades . Artificial intelligence (AI) promises big rewards for investors who hold the right stocks . The following companies are competitively positioned to deliver excellent returns over the long term .  Nvidia's data center revenue more than doubled last year, and now comprises almost 90% of its business . Investors are counting on the company's new Blackwell computing system to drive an estimated 54% revenue increase for the current fiscal year . Blackwell was designed to bring significant performance improvements over the previous Hopper generation of chips for AI tasks .  Nvidia's GPUs can be used for a wide variety of computing purposes . The Mayo Clinic is building a state-of-the-art digital pathology lab to speed up the diagnosis and treatments in healthcare using Nvidia's DGX computing platform . Last year, Nvidia earned $73 billion in net income on $130 billion of revenue .  Microsoft's revenue grew 15% year over year on a constant-currency basis last quarter, with earnings up 19% . Growth was driven across every segment, most notably in the cloud, with Microsoft Azure posting an impressive 35% year-over-year increase .  Microsoft reported that hundreds of thousands of customers across industries are using its Copilot AI assistant . Microsoft is a no-brainer tech stock to buy and hold . It's rock-solid financially, with $96 billion generated in net income on $270 billion of revenue over the last year . The FTC lost a roughly three-year-long attempt to undo Microsoft's $69 billion acquisition of gaming giant Activision Blizzard . A three-judge panel for the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals made it clear that regulators need to show evidence, not solely a theory, that a tie-up will cause real harm to competition .  The unanimous decision pushes back on a wide antitrust enforcement net cast by the Trump and Biden administrations to rein in Big Tech . The government has been successful in arguing that Google illegally monopolized the general search engine market .  The FTC re-upped a challenge to the merger in a lawsuit filed in the agency's in-house court . The appellate court denied its request for an injunction to pause the merger . The FTC had alleged that combining the two companies would hurt competition in three gaming markets .  Microsoft agreed to allow "Call of Duty" on Sony’s PlayStation for 10 years . Under pressure from US regulators and antitrust enforcers in the UK, Microsoft agreed .
